TITLE_UR: دونوں جہان تیری محبت میں ہار کے
TITLE_EN: Donon Jahan Teri Mohabbat Mein Haar Ke
notes: Annotations verified and manually checked for accuracy. The radif 'کے' creates a consistent rhythm throughout. Themes of sacrifice, loss, and the courage to sin.

TITLE_UR: آپ کی یاد آتی رہی رات بھر
TITLE_EN: Aap Ki Yaad Aati Rahi Raat Bhar
RHYME_PATTERNS: AA BA CA DA EA FA GA
notes: Annotations verified and manually checked for accuracy. The radif 'رات بھر' (all night) creates a hypnotic, repetitive effect emphasizing the duration of suffering.

TITLE_UR: نہیں نگاہ میں منزل تو جستجو ہی سہی
TITLE_EN: Nahin Nigah Mein Manzil To Justaju Hi Sahi
notes: Annotations verified and manually checked for accuracy. The radif 'ہی سہی' (let it be) conveys a tone of acceptance and resilience.

TITLE_UR: مجھ سے پہلی سی محبت مری محبوب نہ مانگ
TITLE_EN: Mujh Se Pehli Si Mohabbat Meri Mehboob Na Maang
RHYME_PATTERNS: AA BA CA DA EA FA GA
notes: This is technically a nazm but often recited as a ghazal. A landmark poem marking Faiz's transition from romantic to revolutionary poetry.

TITLE_UR: تنہائی کا سفر ہے تنہائی کی منزل
TITLE_EN: Tanhai Ka Safar Hai Tanhai Ki Manzil
notes: Explores themes of existential loneliness and self-annihilation. The poet reaches a state of complete negation of self and sorrow.

TITLE_UR: شام فراق اب نہ پوچھ آئی اور آ کے ٹل گئی
TITLE_EN: Sham-e-Firaq Ab Na Puchh Aai Aur Aa Ke Tal Gayi
notes: Written at Jinnah Hospital, Karachi in 1953. The radif 'گئی' creates a sense of passing and transience [citation:2].

TITLE_UR: دل ناامید تو نہیں ناکام ہی تو ہے
TITLE_EN: Dil Na-Umeed To Nahin Nakam Hi To Hai
notes: A collection of famous couplets from various Faiz ghazals. The first couplet is particularly renowned [citation:6].

TITLE_UR: گلون میں رنگ بھرے باد نوبہار چلے
TITLE_EN: Gulon Mein Rang Bhare Baad-e-Nau Bahar Chale
notes: A beautiful spring-themed ghazal from Faiz's early period, featured in 'Naqsh-e-Faryadi'.

TITLE_UR: ہم جو تاریک راہوں میں مارے گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Jo Tareek Rahon Mein Mare Gaye
notes: A collection of verses from Faiz's prison poetry, featured in 'Zindan Nama' [citation:4][citation:9].

TITLE_UR: یہ داغ داغ اجالا یہ شب گزیدہ سحر
TITLE_EN: Ye Daagh Daagh Ujla Ye Shab Gazida Seher
notes: A revolutionary ghazal that uses imagery of dawn and light to symbolize hope and freedom.

TITLE_UR: آج بازار میں پا بہ جولاں چلو
TITLE_EN: Aaj Bazaar Mein Pa Bih Jolan Chalo
notes: A joyful ghazal with a revolutionary spirit, featured in 'Dast-e-Tah-e-Sang'. The poem encourages marching forward despite oppression.

TITLE_UR: نظر انداز ہم کو جاں سے کیا
TITLE_EN: Nazar Andaz Hum Ko Jaan Se Kiya
notes: A ghazal exploring the paradox of finding light in the memory of the beloved amidst darkness. The beloved's memory brings illumination to the heart.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے مانا کہ تم سے کچھ نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Mana Ke Tum Se Kuchh Na Mila
notes: A ghazal about the pleasure found in desire itself, even when unfulfilled. Explores the theme of finding satisfaction in longing.

TITLE_UR: کتنی ناداں تھی محبت ہماری
TITLE_EN: Kitni Nadan Thi Mohabbat Hamari
notes: A ghazal reflecting on the innocence of first love and the endless waiting for the beloved. The poet compares love to childlike naivety.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ بہت خوش قسمت تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Bahut Khush Qismat Thay
notes: A philosophical ghazal comparing the fortune of those who could pursue love as a profession. The poet reflects on the nature of waiting and hope.

TITLE_UR: قریب آؤ کہ ہم تم سے پیار کر لیں
TITLE_EN: Qareeb Aao Ke Hum Tum Se Pyaar Kar Lein
notes: A passionate ghazal about the urgency of love and the omnipresence of the beloved's image. The poet sees the beloved's reflection everywhere.

TITLE_UR: تم آئے ہو تو رات ڈھل گئی ہے
TITLE_EN: Tum Aaye Ho To Raat Dhal Gayi Hai
notes: A ghazal about the arrival of the beloved and the fulfillment of longing. The night ends with the beloved's arrival, and thirst is quenched.

TITLE_UR: یوں ہی انتظار کا موسم نہیں گزرتا
TITLE_EN: Yun Hi Intezar Ka Mausam Nahin Guzarta
notes: A ghazal exploring the heaviness of silence and the need for a confidant. The poet struggles to find someone to share his heart's condition.

TITLE_UR: ہم پہ اب بھی ہے اس کی مہربانی
TITLE_EN: Hum Pe Ab Bhi Hai Uski Mehrbani
notes: A ghazal about the bittersweet nature of memory when the beloved no longer comes. The poet finds solace in the fact that she still comes to mind.

TITLE_UR: وہ بات سارے فسانے میں جس کا ذکر نہ تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Baat Sare Fasanay Mein Jis Ka Zikr Na Tha
notes: A ghazal about the unspoken elements in love and the mystery of attachment. The poet questions why the heart remains attached despite everything.

TITLE_UR: ہم دیکھیں گے
TITLE_EN: Hum Dekhenge
RHYME_PATTERNS: AA BA CA DA EA FA GA HA
notes: Faiz's most famous revolutionary poem, written as a protest song during Zia-ul-Haq's regime. It became an anthem of resistance and is recited at political rallies.

TITLE_UR: لہو کا سراغ
TITLE_EN: Lahu Ka Suragh
notes: A poem about the search for justice and the passage of difficult times, from 'Sar-e-Wadi-e-Sina'. Reflects the pain of political oppression.

TITLE_UR: ظلمت کدہ
TITLE_EN: Zulmat Kadah
notes: A ghazal exploring the duality of existence - darkness and light, pain and hope. The world is both a realm of darkness and light simultaneously.

TITLE_UR: جلوۂ یار
TITLE_EN: Jalwa-e-Yaar
notes: A ghazal about the search for divine beauty and the persistence of love despite failure. The poet continues to call out the beloved's name.

TITLE_UR: آئینہ دکھائیے
TITLE_EN: Aaina Dikhayiye
notes: A ghazal exploring self-reflection and the paradox of finding the beloved in one's own image. The poet cannot bear to look at himself in the mirror.

TITLE_UR: کبھی کبھی کوئی خواب آنکھوں میں رہ جاتا ہے
TITLE_EN: Kabhi Kabhi Koi Khwab Aankhon Mein Reh Jata Hai
notes: A ghazal about dreams that persist and words that leave lasting impressions. The contrast between spring and autumn imagery.

TITLE_UR: دل کو ترستے ہی رہنا ہے ترستے ہی رہو
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Taraste Hi Rehna Hai Taraste Hi Raho
notes: A ghazal about perpetual longing and waiting that becomes a way of life. The repetition of 'رہو' emphasizes the endless nature of waiting.

TITLE_UR: یہی زندگی ہے تو کیا زندگی
TITLE_EN: Yahi Zindagi Hai To Kya Zindagi
notes: A philosophical ghazal questioning the meaning of life without love or memory of the beloved. The radif 'زندگی' emphasizes the central theme.

TITLE_UR: تم آئے تو کہا تھا زندگی مل گئی
TITLE_EN: Tum Aaye To Kaha Tha Zindagi Mil Gayi
notes: A ghazal about finding life in the beloved's presence and solace in their memory. The radif 'گئی' creates a sense of completion and finality.

TITLE_UR: رات بھر دیکھتے رہے ان کو
TITLE_EN: Raat Bhar Dekhte Rahe Un Ko
notes: A ghazal about watching the beloved all night, oblivious to time passing. The moon imagery represents the beloved's beauty.

TITLE_UR: وہ آتے تو کہتے کہ دل ہے نہیں
TITLE_EN: Wo Aate To Kahte Ke Dil Hai Nahin
notes: A ghazal about the mystery of the beloved's indifference and hidden feelings. The beloved both settles in eyes and descends into heart.

TITLE_UR: دل کی بات کہیں تک نہ گئی
TITLE_EN: Dil Ki Baat Kahin Tak Na Gayi
notes: A ghazal about unexpressed feelings and the endless waiting for the beloved. The radif 'گئی' emphasizes things that remain unfinished.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم بچھڑے تو شاید کبھی خوابوں میں ملیں
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Bichhde To Shayad Kabhi Khwabon Mein Milein
notes: A famous ghazal about separation and the hope of meeting in dreams. The opening line is one of Faiz's most quoted verses. The radif 'ملیں' creates a sense of possibility.

TITLE_UR: ہم جو بھی ہیں تمہارے ہیں
TITLE_EN: Hum Jo Bhi Hain Tumhare Hain
notes: A ghazal about complete belonging to the beloved and the mystery of their hidden feelings. The radif 'ہے' creates a sense of present truth.

TITLE_UR: اب تو عادت سی ہے مجھ کو
TITLE_EN: Ab To Aadat Si Hai Mujh Ko
notes: A ghazal about the habit of smiling in grief and the constant presence of the beloved's memory in both loneliness and gatherings.

TITLE_UR: یہ جو ایک شمع جلتی ہے
TITLE_EN: Ye Jo Ek Shamma Jalti Hai
notes: A ghazal using the candle as a metaphor for the waiting heart, burning with hope. The radif 'ہے' emphasizes the present continuous state.

TITLE_UR: کچھ اس کی یاد نے ایسے گھیرا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh Uski Yaad Ne Aise Ghera
notes: A ghazal about how the beloved's memory consumes all other thoughts and makes the world meaningless without them.

TITLE_UR: وہ ہم نہیں جو پہلے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Hum Nahin Jo Pehle Thay
notes: A ghazal about transformation through suffering and the impossibility of finding anyone like the beloved. The radif 'تھے' creates a sense of past state.

TITLE_UR: چاندنی رات میں تنہا
TITLE_EN: Chandni Raat Mein Tanha
notes: A ghazal about the burden of memory in moonlit nights and the torment of love. Moon imagery enhances the romantic melancholy.

TITLE_UR: دل تو بہل گیا مگر
TITLE_EN: Dil To Behal Gaya Magar
notes: A ghazal about the persistence of memory and the habit of smiling through grief. Despite distraction, memory returns.

TITLE_UR: اب کسی کے غم میں جلنا کیا
TITLE_EN: Ab Kisi Ke Gham Mein Jalna Kya
notes: A ghazal about a single call that promised life and the suspicion that unfaithfulness hides something deeper.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Ek Baar Mil Gaya Tha
notes: A ghazal about a significant meeting that defines what meeting means, and how grief increases when expected to decrease.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Hai Jo Uss Ne Chhupaya
notes: A ghazal about hidden things beneath indifference and the heart's eternal dissatisfaction despite all experience.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Kar
notes: A ghazal about the power of a single glance to erase sorrow and the habit of smiling in grief. The heart eternally watches the same path.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ka Khayal Aaya
notes: A ghazal about the persistence of memory and the final state of knowing nothing at all except the beloved's thought.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjhaya Bahut Par Woh
notes: A ghazal about the heart's obsession and the beautiful imagery of the heart going to the beloved's lane when the moon rises.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Ab Chain Mile Ga
notes: A ghazal about peace receding further when sought, and the torment of dreams where the heart turns against itself.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو ہم سے مل کر مسکرائے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Hum Se Mil Kar Muskurae Thay
notes: A ghazal about an enduring smile that remains in memory, and the state of not wanting to meet even oneself.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کی یاد آئی تو
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ki Yaad Aai To
notes: A ghazal about a day lost entirely to memory, and the question of whose memory consumed Faiz's days.

TITLE_UR: دل ناشاد کو تجھ سے کوئی امید نہیں
TITLE_EN: Dil-e-Nashad Ko Tujh Se Koi Umeed Nahi
notes: A ghazal about hopeless hope and the endless fascination with the beloved's story. The radif 'نہیں' emphasizes negation and absence.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ کہاں گئے جو کہتے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Kahan Gaye Jo Kehte Thay
notes: A ghazal about those who promised to search but themselves got lost. The radif 'تھے' creates a sense of past existence now lost.

TITLE_UR: یوں تو سب ہیں غم زدہ لیکن
TITLE_EN: Yun To Sab Hain Gham-zada Lekin
notes: A ghazal distinguishing between ordinary grief and the beloved's grief that penetrates deeper and remains in the eyes.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم نے سوچا ہے
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Ne Socha Hai
notes: A ghazal about the conflict between decision and emotion, and the heaviness of silence.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو دن میں بھی اندھیرا ہوتا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Din Mein Bhi Andhera Hota
notes: A ghazal wishing for darkness to escape memories, and the endless waiting that consumes life.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھا کر یہ کہا کرتے تھے
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjha Kar Ye Kaha Karte Thay
notes: A ghazal about a single call that promised life. The suspicion that unfaithfulness hides something deeper is explored.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Ek Baar Mil Gaya Tha
notes: A ghazal about a significant meeting that defines what meeting means. The beloved will be remembered even after death. Grief increases when expected to decrease.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjhaya Bahut Par Woh
notes: A ghazal about the heart's obsession. The beautiful imagery of the heart going to the beloved's lane when the moon rises is a classic Faiz motif.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Hai Jo Uss Ne Chhupaya
notes: A ghazal about hidden things beneath indifference and the heart's eternal dissatisfaction despite all experience.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Ab Chain Mile Ga
notes: A ghazal about peace receding further when sought, and the torment of dreams where the heart turns against itself.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ وہ بھول گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Woh Bhool Gaye
notes: A ghazal about the irony of assuming the beloved has forgotten when she actually remembers. Life's constant state remains unchanged.

TITLE_UR: ہم سے جو بات کہی تم نے سن لی ہم نے
TITLE_EN: Hum Se Jo Baat Kahi Tum Ne Sun Li Hum Ne
notes: A ghazal about words that are heard and cherished, and the conflict between promises of forgetting and remembering. The radif 'نے' emphasizes agency.

TITLE_UR: یوں تو ہر چہرہ پہ اجنبیت چھائی ہے
TITLE_EN: Yun To Har Chehra Pe Ajnabiyat Chhayi Hai
notes: A ghazal about the beloved's face being the only one not strange. The radif 'ہے' creates a sense of present truth.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے چاہا تو بہت پر نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Chaha To Bahut Par Na Mila
notes: A ghazal about the grief of forgetting and the paradoxical pleasure found in the heart's burning. Fate and destiny themes appear.

TITLE_UR: یوں نہیں کہ اس کا غم کم ہو گیا
TITLE_EN: Yun Nahin Ke Uss Ka Gham Kam Ho Gaya
notes: A ghazal about how grief becomes habitual, and the desolation of paths once walked together. The radif 'گیا' creates a sense of transformation.

TITLE_UR: اب تو گزرے دن بھی یاد نہیں
TITLE_EN: Ab To Guzray Din Bhi Yaad Nahin
notes: A ghazal about the erasure of both past and future from memory, leaving only a heavy silence. The radif 'نہیں' emphasizes negation.

TITLE_UR: کچھ نہیں تو یہ دل ہے
TITLE_EN: Kuchh Nahin To Ye Dil Hai
notes: A ghazal about the preciousness of the heart, the persistence of memory, and total sacrifice for the beloved.

TITLE_UR: اب اس کے بعد کس سے ملیے
TITLE_EN: Ab Uss Ke Baad Kis Se Miliye
notes: A ghazal about seeing the beloved's reflection everywhere after separation. The beloved's image is both in the heart and in every face.

TITLE_UR: وہ بات سارے فسانے میں جس کا ذکر نہ تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Baat Sare Fasanay Mein Jis Ka Zikr Na Tha
notes: A ghazal about the unspoken elements in love and the mystery of attachment. The thing not mentioned becomes most significant.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے مانا کہ تم سے کچھ نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Mana Ke Tum Se Kuchh Na Mila
notes: A ghazal about the pleasure found in desire itself, even when unfulfilled. The world's sorrow becomes the beloved's sorrow.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ بہت خوش قسمت تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Bahut Khush Qismat Thay
notes: A philosophical ghazal comparing the fortune of those who could pursue love as a profession. The radif 'تھے' emphasizes past state.

TITLE_UR: قریب آؤ کہ ہم تم سے پیار کر لیں
TITLE_EN: Qareeb Aao Ke Hum Tum Se Pyaar Kar Lein
notes: A passionate ghazal about the urgency of love. The beloved's image is seen on every face after separation.

TITLE_UR: یوں ہی انتظار کا موسم نہیں گزرتا
TITLE_EN: Yun Hi Intezar Ka Mausam Nahin Guzarta
notes: A ghazal exploring the heaviness of silence and the need for a confidant. The heart's words cannot be shared.

TITLE_UR: ہم پہ اب بھی ہے اس کی مہربانی
TITLE_EN: Hum Pe Ab Bhi Hai Uski Mehrbani
notes: A ghazal about the bittersweet nature of memory when the beloved no longer comes. The heart becomes accustomed to absence.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم بچھڑے تو شاید
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Bichhde To Shayad
notes: A famous ghazal about separation and the hope of meeting in dreams. The imagery of dried flowers in books is iconic.

TITLE_UR: وہ ہم نہیں جو پہلے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Hum Nahin Jo Pehle Thay
notes: A ghazal about transformation through suffering. The radif 'تھے' creates a sense of past state and lost identity.

TITLE_UR: اب کسی کے غم میں جلنا کیا
TITLE_EN: Ab Kisi Ke Gham Mein Jalna Kya
notes: A ghazal about a single call that promised life. The suspicion that unfaithfulness hides something deeper is explored.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Kar
notes: A ghazal about the power of a single glance to erase sorrow. The habit of smiling in grief becomes defining.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ka Khayal Aaya
notes: A ghazal about the persistence of memory. The final state of knowing nothing at all except the beloved's thought.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjhaya Bahut Par Woh
notes: A ghazal about the heart's obsession. The imagery of the heart going to the beloved's lane when the moon rises is beautiful.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Ab Chain Mile Ga
notes: A ghazal about peace receding further when sought. The torment of dreams is a powerful theme.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Hai Jo Uss Ne Chhupaya
notes: A ghazal about hidden things beneath indifference. Both meeting and departure were significant.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Kar
notes: A ghazal about the power of a single glance. The heart eternally watches the same path.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ka Khayal Aaya
notes: A ghazal about the persistence of memory. Words spoken remain eternal.

TITLE_UR: دل تو بہل گیا تھا کچھ دیر
TITLE_EN: Dil To Behal Gaya Tha Kuchh Der
notes: A ghazal about the cycle of distraction and return to memory. The beloved dwells in the eyes.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ وہ بھول گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Woh Bhool Gaye
notes: A ghazal about the irony of assuming the beloved has forgotten when she actually remembers. Life's constant state remains unchanged.
